column5: Hey all.  Well I'm in need of some new winter boots; so who's better to ask then you all?      I don't want to spend more then $100 if I don't have to.  I'm looking for something light and warm for walking to work and back to the GO station.  I have my other ice fishing boots but they are too heavy and starting to smell (I think HH likes the smell tho   ).  So, any ideas?  Thanks.  Geoff
CT has an assortment. Have had a pair for 3 years half leather half rubber. Warm and waterproof.

Try some snowmobile type boots with a replaceable liner. All kinds of those available at marks workwear and CT, Zellers, Sears, etc. Good time to buy a pair as a lot of stores have sales on those items. Get an extra pair of liners and switch them when wet. Warm and light.  muddler

Take your pick! Ct search winter boots . . .   http://www.canadiantire.ca/search/search_results.jsp;jsessionid=NnwphTQrc7yqr6JTmhJ1pzv4wh5qXTLdjmwBynlLFJVp87ZwJDvX!270093604?bmForm=form_endeca_search&bmFormID=1294430303233&bmUID=1294430303233&bmIsForm=true&bmPrevTemplate=%2Fhome.jsp&bmHidden=OMNITURE_FROM&OMNITURE_FROM=Search&bmHidden=event26&event26=true&bmText=quick_search_term&quick_search_term=winter+boots&bmSubmit=quick_search&quick_search=Search&bmHidden=FOLDER%3C%3Efolder_id&FOLDER%3C%3Efolder_id=1408474396672077
I have the Baffin -100 boots from Royal Distributing, very warm and somewhat light, they were under 100 bucks

i bought a pair of columbia bugaboots on sale for just over 100 bucks.  ive only worn them a couple of times so far but they are really comfortable, light and quite warm. they're my "everyday" winter boot but im gonna try and see how they do icefishing this weekend.   ryan
thanks Ryan and Lefroy.  I'm looking for an 'everyday' type of boot. I was just at CT and the products and prices sucked...
gbw     ooooops  :/
GBW  heres a link to the boots im talking about, have a hiking boot look to them almost  bugaboots

thanks Ryan. this is the type of boot I'm looking for.  you consider it light?  I walk up and down Bay from Union to Richmond and back all week.  where did you get them?  hard to tell for me right now as I'm not on my home pc...cheers. Geoff
Hmmm, I thought the "stroll" was on Church Street...... Those boots are made for walkin' I think you will be pleased.
ONLY GET BAFFIN! The best of the beat!

i bought them at sportchek, but lots of places seem to have them.  you'd probably get the best pricing online somewhere, just go to the store to size them or whatever then buy online.  that was my plan, but they were on sale when i went in to try some on.  as for considering it light... well i wear workboots all day, so these are definitelty lighter than what im used to wearing  ryan
I wear snow board boots.Had them now for 3 years.Nice and warm. Oh they are a  bit more then yer price,but worth it.  As for the Baffins,I have a pr of steel toe pair for work.They are the best.
I sell Baffin at my store give me a call 905-544-6858 open 9 to 5
..but they can't be toooo warm, as he also walks thru the Eaton Centre looking for stretchy pants!!

PM me where you are please  LMAO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   The best part about reading that was when I LOL my wife asked "what's so funny?"    I did find the Columbia boots on sale around the corner for $99.00 too...

If you can try on a pair of Red Wing's. I've bought probably 20+ pairs of boots under $100 and none of them have fit so nice out of the box. They're warm in the snow yet my feet don't get too hot while driving. They're light, dry and have as much grip as my Sorel's. When I need to replace them, Red Wing will be my first stop and I don't regret paying over $100.
Kamlik is that how its spelt??? Anyways $55.00 on sale at Crappytire this morming in Brampton. Couldnt resist.
I went to a softmoc outlet today and picked up a $100 pair of boots for $40.  nice, light and the price tag was good too...
